result.execSummary:
The defendant Xay C. Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.

All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy and provide authorization permitting release of pharmacy records to his agent. 
Engage in any counseling recommended by his agent and thought necessary and appropriate to rehabilitate. 
Court has no objection to transfer of probation to Minnesota if acceptable to Corrections there.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xay C. Vang in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Xay C. Vang in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF162, 15CF322, 15CT139, 16CF113, 16CF114, 16CF188, 16CF252, 16CF434
3:50 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF162 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF322 Count 1 - NO CONTEST 
16CF252 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following: 
15CF162 Count 1
15CF322 Count 1
16CF252 Count 1 
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

The following are dismissed and read-in: 
15CF162 Count 2
15CF322 Count 2
16CF252 Counts 2 thru 6
15CT139 in its entirety
16CF113 in its entirety
16CF114 in its entirety
16CF188 in its entirety
16CF434 in its entirety

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
88 days credit on both 15CF162 and 16CF252.

15CF162 Count 1 - 
3 1/2 years prison with 1 1/2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision STAYED
Placed on Probation for 24 months: 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
All prescription to be filled at the same pharmacy and provide authorization permit release of pharmacy records to his agent.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any counseling recommended by his agent and thought necessary and appropriate to rehabilitate.
Pay court costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Court has no objection to transfer of probation to Minnesota if acceptable to Corrections there. 

15CF322 Count 1 -
Serve 20 days jail.
Time served sentence. 
Pay fine of $200 plus costs including DNA surcharge. 

16CF252 Count 1 
4 years prison with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision STAYED
Concurrent to any other sentence imposed by this Court. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Same conditions as imposed in 15CF162.
Pay costs. 

Any cash on bond is to be applied to the costs and surcharges and fines on the sentenced charges.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 1, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 17, 2017 at 09:30 am.
filed by Atty Acalia Halverson
Atty Acalia Halverson
Pre-trial conference on March 27, 2017 at 09:30 am.

This cash bond to cover all cases 16CF188, 15CF162, 15CF322, 16CF434, 16CF252, 15CT139, 16CF14 and with same non-monetary conditions of previous bonds.
 Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on scheduled court dates. Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.

Defendant Xay C. Vang appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CF188, 15CF162, 15CF322, 16CF434, 16CF252, 15CT139, 16CF14 are heard on return on warrant. Bonds were forfeited prior when warrants were ordered. State request $5,000 cash bond to cover all bonds with same non monetary conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney John M Bliss in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:42 a.m.   Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant Record Update

Defendant Xay C. Vang in court with attorney John M Bliss. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CF-113, 15CF-322, 15CF-162, 15CT-139, 16CF-252, 16CF-114,  and 16CF-188.

11:04 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Court has preliminary waivers signed by Defendant. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney Bliss.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Bliss has received a copy of the informations and waives reading.
Atty Bliss enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Court accepts the pleas.

Parties will discuss further and a pretrial sheet will be filled out.

Defendant Xay C. Vang in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF162, 15CF322, 15CT139, 16CF188, 16CF1145 and 15CF113 heard today.

3:02 p.m.  Court calls case and appearances are stated.

Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Atty Bliss is not in court today.
Defendant is not sure where his attorney is today.
Defendant indicates that he has spoken with his attorney but not sure why he is not at today's Court hearing.

Bond ordered continued.  
Status Conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xay C. Vang in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CF-188, 15CT-139, 15CF-322, 15CF-162, 16CF-113 and 16CF-114.

1:45 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Case was to be heard at 1:15 PM but Defendant was sitting out on the hallway.

Address of Defendant is verified.
Defendant lives with his brother. 

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
.

Defendant is represented by Atty Bliss on his other cases.

Defendant failed to appear in court on April 22nd. All the warrants went out for arrest.

Defendant was aware of the date, was working because it was mandatory work.

16CF-113 and 16CF-114 Defendant has not made an initial appearance on these cases.

Atty Knaapen provides copies of criminal complaints on 16CF-113 and 114.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties on these cases.
Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Court advises Defendant to contact the public defender's office to let them know an attorney needs to be appointed on these two cases as well. 

State addresses bond, $750 cash bond for all three files (16CF-188, 16CF-113 and 16CF-114).

Defendant agrees with the bond.

BY THE COURT:
Court will reinstate the bond on the old cases.
$250 on each bond, that totals $750 
Condition: Comply with all conditions set forth in all other bonds.

Initial appearances will be continued on 16CF-188, 16CF-113 and 16CF-114. May 16, 2016 at 1:30 PM Branch 3
Other files will be set for status on that date/time.

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's Department until bond is posted on all three files.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
